info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:47PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Union, Jackson, eastern Perry and northeastern Cape Girardeau Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along the Mississippi River from 8 miles northeast of Perryville to 8 miles northeast of Jackson, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. The storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Union County, as well as the following locations... Gorham, Pocahontas, Murphysboro, Makanda, Campbell Hill, and Alto Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
